text: How do you select the foreground color in MS Paint?

options.text: Right-click a color in the Color Palette
Left-click a color in the Color Palette

explanation: Left-clicking a color in the Color Palette selects it as the foreground color, which is the color used for drawing and filling by default.

text: What is the function of the Color Picker (Eyedropper) tool in MS Paint?

options.text: Selects a color from the canvas

explanation: The Eyedropper tool samples a color from any point on the canvas, allowing you to use that exact color for drawing or filling.

text: What happens when you right-click a color in the MS Paint Color Palette?

options.text: It opens a custom color menu

explanation: Right-clicking a color in the Color Palette selects it as the background color. This color is used for the eraser tool and creating transparent backgrounds.

text: What is the function of the Fill tool (Paint Bucket) in MS Paint?

options.text: Fills an enclosed area with color

explanation: The Fill tool uses the currently selected foreground color to fill completely enclosed areas.  If the area is not enclosed, it will flood fill the entire canvas.

text: How can you create a custom color in MS Paint?

options.text: Click "Edit Colors" in the Color Palette

explanation: The "Edit Colors" option in the Color Palette opens a dialog box where you can create and customize your own colors.

text: What does a transparent fill do in MS Paint?
explanation: A transparent fill allows the underlying color or image to show through, making the fill appear invisible.

text: Which color is used by the Fill tool by default in MS Paint?
explanation: The Fill tool automatically uses the currently selected foreground color to fill shapes or areas.

text: What happens if you use the Fill tool on an unenclosed area in MS Paint?
explanation: The Fill tool performs a flood fill on unenclosed areas, filling the entire canvas with the foreground color.

text: How do you switch between foreground and background colors in MS Paint?

options.text: Click the color boxes in the Color Palette

explanation: Clicking on either the foreground or background color box in the Color Palette will swap the two colors.

text: What is the purpose of the Color Palette in MS Paint?
explanation: The Color Palette provides a selection of colors and allows you to choose the foreground and background colors for your drawings.

text: Which tool allows you to match a color on the canvas in MS Paint?
explanation: The Color Picker (Eyedropper) tool lets you select a color directly from the image on the canvas.

text: What does a solid fill do in MS Paint?

options.text: Fills the area with a single color

explanation: A solid fill completely covers the selected area with the chosen foreground color, leaving no transparency.

text: How do you access the custom color creator in MS Paint?

options.text: Click "Edit Colors" in the Color Palette

explanation: The "Edit Colors" button in the Color Palette opens the custom color mixer, allowing you to create new colors by adjusting RGB values or using a color picker.

text: What happens when you use the Eraser with the background color selected in MS Paint?

options.text: It fills with the foreground color
It replaces the area with the background color

explanation: The Eraser tool uses the background color to remove pixels, effectively 'erasing' them and replacing them with the background color.

text: Which option ensures a shapeâ€™s interior remains transparent in MS Paint?
explanation: Selecting "No Fill" prevents the shape's interior from being filled with any color, leaving it transparent and showing the background.

text: How do you add text to the canvas in MS Paint?
explanation: The Text tool is specifically designed for adding text to the MS Paint canvas.

text: How can you change the font size in MS Paint?

options.text: Select a size from the Font dropdown

explanation: The Font dropdown menu within the Text tool options allows you to select different font sizes for your text.

text: What is a key limitation of text editing in MS Paint?

options.text: You cannot change the font color
You cannot edit text after deselecting the text box
You cannot add text at all
You cannot resize the text box

explanation: Once you click outside the text box, the text becomes rasterized (part of the image) and is no longer editable.

text: What does the opaque text background do in MS Paint?

options.text: Adds a solid background color behind the text

explanation: An opaque background fills the text box with the background color, making the text stand out more clearly.

text: How do you make the text background transparent in MS Paint?

options.text: Select Transparent in the Text toolbar

explanation: The Text toolbar has an option to make the text background transparent, allowing the background image to show through.

text: Which tool is used to move a text box in MS Paint?
explanation: While the Text tool is active, you can click and drag the text box to reposition it on the canvas.

text: What happens if you try to edit text after clicking outside the text box in MS Paint?

options.text: The text becomes part of the canvas

explanation: Clicking outside the text box finalizes the text, making it a part of the image and no longer editable as text.

text: How do you change the font style in MS Paint?

options.text: Select a font from the Font dropdown

explanation: The Font dropdown menu in the Text tool options provides a list of available font styles to choose from.

text: Which color is used for text by default in MS Paint?
explanation: New text in MS Paint will automatically use the currently selected foreground color.

text: How can you resize a text box in MS Paint?

options.text: Drag the edges of the text box

explanation: You can resize the text box by dragging the small squares (handles) at the corners and edges of the box.

text: What happens when you select the Transparent text background option in MS Paint?

options.text: The text box shows the canvas beneath it

explanation: Selecting "Transparent" for the text background makes the background of the text box invisible, revealing any underlying image or color.

text: Which tab contains the Text tool in MS Paint?
explanation: The Text tool is located on the Home tab of the MS Paint interface.

text: What is a key limitation of the Text tool in MS Paint?

options.text: You cannot change the font size
You cannot add multiple text boxes at once
You cannot change the text color
You cannot move the text box

explanation: Only one text box can be active and edited at a time in MS Paint.

text: How do you change the text color in MS Paint?

options.text: Select a color from the Color Palette

explanation: The text color is determined by the currently selected foreground color.

text: What happens if you deselect a text box before finishing editing in MS Paint?

options.text: The text is saved as editable
The text becomes part of the canvas

explanation: Deselecting a text box converts the text into a raster image, making it uneditable as text.
